title: Women’s Economic Empowerment in the Face of Covid-19 and Displacement
summary: The Covid-19 pandemic has had a devastating impact on the lives and livelihoods of women globally. This research clearly demonstrates that women affected by crisis and displacement have been hit by a ‘triple disadvantage’ of Covid-19, displacement and gender discrimination. Findings from research in Jordan, Greece and Nigeria evidence clear gender differences in the ability to earn an income, be employed in salaried formal work and take on responsibility for unpaid care work throughout the pandemic, with women hit hardest.
